data.title: Anthony Quinn Art For Sale
data.text:
Anthony Quinn, Mexican (1915 - 2001)

Anthony Quinn was born in Chihuahua, Mexico and his family moved to Los Angeles when he was four years old. Before becoming an Oscar winning actor, Quinn had been a prizefighter and a painter.

His first movie roll was in 1936. He made more than 100 films and appeared in several plays and television dramas.

Between takes on location and films he drew, painted and sculpted. Some of his best sculpture was created in Africa during the 1970s and 80s while he was working on a film there. Quinn was also a student and friend of Frank Lloyd Wright.

Anthony Quinn was a multi-faceted man of the world, intense, sensitive and dramatic. He is known to millions as a great performing artist for his work on the stage and in films; he is known only to a select few as a painter and sculptor.

He had boundless creative energies and talents and two consummate passions, women and his art.

At the age of 86, Anthony Quinn died of respiratory failure in Boston, Massachusetts.

The Following Art is For Sale. Please use our Contact Us form for any additional information on these works or to request works by other artists.

Freight charges are NOT included in the pricing and will be billed at actual cost.

Framing disclaimer: The asking price of the artwork is based on unframed values. If a work is framed, the seller may include the frame as added protection in shipping. These frames are usually older and are considered used. Frame are sold "AS IS" and we will only insure the artwork and not the frames during shipping.

CLICK ON THE THUMBNAIL, TO VIEW THE BEST IMAGE OF THE ARTWORK
